content:
• Thursday, October 13, 2011
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) files for a 2.5M-share secondary offering on behalf of a...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) files for a 2.5M-share secondary offering on behalf of a shareholder. Shares -9.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM
  • ASRT

    Shares of Depomed (DEPO) get clobbered in the post trading session after the company says...

    Shares of Depomed (DEPO) get clobbered in the post trading session after the company says top-line results from its Phase 3 trial evaluating the efficacy and safety of Serada, a drug for menopausal hot flashes, missed on a key secondary endpoint evaluation. Shares -24% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • PNSN

    Penson Worldwide (OTC:PNSN) signs an agreement with Broadridge Financial Solutions (NYSE:BR) to...

    Penson Worldwide (OTC:PNSN) signs an agreement with Broadridge Financial Solutions (NYSE:BR) to expand the scope of business processing services that it will outsource. OTC:PNSN +2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • NAV

    Carl Icahn's latest target: Navistar (NYSE:NAV). In an SEC filing, Icahn discloses a...

    Carl Icahn's latest target: Navistar (NYSE:NAV). In an SEC filing, Icahn discloses a 9.8% stake in Navistar, says he sees the shares as undervalued, and says he has talked with management about adding representatives to the board. NAV +6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • MXIM

    Analog chipmaker Maxim Integrated (NASDAQ:MXIM) drops 1.6% AH after announcing it's obtained a...

    Analog chipmaker Maxim Integrated (NASDAQ:MXIM) drops 1.6% AH after announcing it's obtained a $250M credit facility. The company says it will use borrowing from the facility "for general corporate purposes, including funding acquisitions and repurchasing its common stock."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • GOOG

    More on Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) Q3 results: International markets accounted for 55% of revenue,...

    More on Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) Q3 results: International markets accounted for 55% of revenue, up from 52% in year-ago period. Paid clicks increased 28% Y/Y, while cost per click grew 5% Y/Y (but fell 5% Q/Q). Operating expenses were 34% of revenue, up from 30% in year-ago period. Stock compensation expenses grew 50% Y/Y, to $571M. GOOG +5.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q3 EPS of $9.72 beats by $0.98. Revenue of $7.51B (+37% Y/Y) beats by...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q3 EPS of $9.72 beats by $0.98. Revenue of $7.51B (+37% Y/Y) beats by $300M. GOOG +6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 9 Comments
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC +8.6%) closes higher on speculation that Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A +1.8%) is...

    Range Resources (RRC +8.6%) closes higher on speculation that Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A +1.8%) is considering buying it. The company has been a consistent subject of takeover rumors lately due to its valuable shale assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS +4.8%) is one more name that caught a bid on Clearwire's (CLWR +26.9%) Q3...

    MetroPCS (PCS +4.8%) is one more name that caught a bid on Clearwire's (CLWR +26.9%) Q3 preannouncement. Both companies added to their gains after MetroPCS' CFO said his company "might be uniquely positioned" to strike a deal to use Clearwire's massive spectrum holdings in major metro areas.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • LPX

    RBC upgrades beaten-down building products supplier Louisiana-Pacific (LPX +3.5%) to Outperform...

    RBC upgrades beaten-down building products supplier Louisiana-Pacific (LPX +3.5%) to Outperform "as the share price is discounting an overly pessimistic outlook for" strand-board prices. The stock has been cut by a third since July, and RBC notes a seasonal upswing in wood-panel prices is key to its call on LPX.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • FCX

    London copper -2.9% after new estimates suggested China's copper inventories were a...

    London copper -2.9% after new estimates suggested China's copper inventories were a higher-than-expected 1.9M tons at the end of last year. Analysts debate the accuracy of the figure, but emphasize its importance: If Chinese stockpiles are so high, it could add to speculation that China's real copper consumption hasn't been as high as previously thought. FCX -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • HCSG

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG -3.5%) takes a hit after Duncan Williams cuts the shares to hold...

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG -3.5%) takes a hit after Duncan Williams cuts the shares to hold on valuation. The firm says that although it continues to see the stock as a core holding for investors, it's trading at a 10% premium to current 2012 revenue growth estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +17.6%) soars after a senior Chinese government official encourages agencies to...

    Sina (SINA +17.6%) soars after a senior Chinese government official encourages agencies to "actively" use microblogs for information disclosure, reversing worries over regulatory risk for the owner of the Twitter-like Weibo service in China. Weibo had more than 180M users by the end of June.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • THG

    Hanover Insurance Group (THG -5.4%) trades down after saying late yesterday it estimates the Q3...

    Hanover Insurance Group (THG -5.4%) trades down after saying late yesterday it estimates the Q3 impact of unusually severe weather on its commercial and personal lines to range between $110M-$115M, with an EPS impact of around $1.57-$1.65 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM +2.5%) shares move up after the supplier of communications chips for Apple's...

    Broadcom (BRCM +2.5%) shares move up after the supplier of communications chips for Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) mobile devices is raised to Outperform from Neutral, with a price target of $46 from $35, at Robert W. Baird. Baird likes signs of momentum for BRCM's wireless businesses, in concert with improving signs from the cellphone supply chain. TXN +2.7%, MU +5.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • RNOW

    Despite an earlier downgrade by Needham, RightNow Technologies (RNOW +1.7%) moves higher after...

    Despite an earlier downgrade by Needham, RightNow Technologies (RNOW +1.7%) moves higher after Piper Jaffray issues positive comments and reiterates its overweight rating on the shares. Piper says the company's Q4 is looking good. Its channel checks indicate strong business momentum across multiple verticals, with its professional services unit posting a significant backlog of business and solid demand for its cloud-based services.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -6.7%) is giving back some of yesterday's GM-induced gains. Though A123...

    A123 Systems (AONE -6.7%) is giving back some of yesterday's GM-induced gains. Though A123 claims its deal with GM will produce "substantial revenue" by 2014, Clean Energy Intel thinks "range anxiety" for all-electric cars could limit sales. It considers Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA), with its ability to offer cars with a 300-mile range, "a better bet."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • JPM

    Banks that issue a lot of credit cards are feeling pain, after JPMorgan Chase (JPM -4.9%) CFO...

    Banks that issue a lot of credit cards are feeling pain, after JPMorgan Chase (JPM -4.9%) CFO Doug Braunstein warned on the company’s conference call that the decline in net charge-offs this quarter should continue in Q4, "but after that you shouldn’t expect much additional improvement." COF -3.3%, DFS -4.2%, ADS -6.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • CMD

    Cantel Medical (CMN -6%), a maker of infection prevention products, dives after reporting FQ4...

    Cantel Medical (CMN -6%), a maker of infection prevention products, dives after reporting FQ4 revenue of $86M (+23% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.27, missing consensus by $5.4M and $0.04. The company's gross margin declined to 37.1%, from 39.7% in the year-ago period. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • MERC

    Mercer (MERC -8.9%) trades lower after RBC cut the shares to sector perform, citing weakening...

    Mercer (MERC -8.9%) trades lower after RBC cut the shares to sector perform, citing weakening pulp fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • DE

    Deere (DE -3.3%) shares sink in afternoon trade on a Bloomberg report that dealers are saying...

    Deere (DE -3.3%) shares sink in afternoon trade on a Bloomberg report that dealers are saying the company plans to deliver fewer combines in the U.S. as demand falls amid a glut of used machinery. Combines account for about a third of Deere’s North American farm equipment revenue and are its highest-margin products. CAT -0.9%, AGCO -2.5%, JOYG -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMSI

    Smith Micro Software (SMSI -14%) dips after it says preliminary Q3 sales will come in short of...

    Smith Micro Software (SMSI -14%) dips after it says preliminary Q3 sales will come in short of expectations due to a large asset-impairment charge. The company now says sales will come in around $12.6M, below analysts expectations for $17M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • OC

    Owens Corning (OC +1.8%) follows up its earnings beat by catching an Overweight rating from...

    Owens Corning (OC +1.8%) follows up its earnings beat by catching an Overweight rating from Barclays, as analysts with the firm initiate coverage. Shares of Owens Corning - jumpy this year due to close ties to the housing industry - look to stabilize after the company issues positive guidance on its roofing and insulation business for H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • BZH

    Shares of Beazer Homes (BZH +6.5%) surge after the homebuilder releases strong preliminary Q4...

    Shares of Beazer Homes (BZH +6.5%) surge after the homebuilder releases strong preliminary Q4 data: orders jumped 33%, home closings rose 23%, and backlog of homes under contract soared 88% Y/Y, perhaps suggesting improvement in the housing market. Shares of rivals aren't helped: DRI -2.9%, LEN -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +2.5%) gains after Rodman & Renshaw initiates it with an outperform,...

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +2.5%) gains after Rodman & Renshaw initiates it with an outperform, saying the stock is "markedly undervalued," and a pure play in muscle biology that is "awaiting rediscovery by the investment community.”
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • ON

    Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS +9%) stages a stunning reversal after opening down over 7% this...

    Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS +9%) stages a stunning reversal after opening down over 7% this morning on disappointing Q3 results and dismal FY11 follow-on guidance. Earnings were flat on an overall decline in revenue, and margins took a hit on lower factory loadings and start-up costs. Despite it all, the stock rallied out of the gate on heavy buying as investors appear to be playing into a continuation off a bounce near its 52-week low hit last Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +30.1%) continues to surge after preannouncing Q3 results, and is taking...

    Clearwire (CLWR +30.1%) continues to surge after preannouncing Q3 results, and is taking ambivalent partner Sprint (S +7.4%) along for the ride. Well Fargo remains bullish (previously), noting Clearwire's 1.9M net subscriber adds beat its 1.5M estimate. But Citi is more guarded, on account of Clearwire's funding needs and Sprint's LTE plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • KV.B

    K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A +22%) soars following a brief halt after it says information from two...

    K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A +22%) soars following a brief halt after it says information from two distinguished medical research bodies confirm that its FDA-approved Makena and unapproved compounded 17P formulations are not identical. The update clears previous concerns that were used by insurers to deny coverage for Makena prescriptions.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • AAPL

    IFixit's teardown of the iPhone 4S (NASDAQ:AAPL) finds a couple of TriQuint (TQNT +19%) power...

    IFixit's teardown of the iPhone 4S (NASDAQ:AAPL) finds a couple of TriQuint (TQNT +19%) power amplifiers inside, and that's going well with investors who feared lost business. Avago (AVGO +2.1%) and Skyworks (SWKS +0.9%) amplifiers are also found, and a Qualcomm (QCOM +1%) RF transceiver chip is present in addition to an expected baseband chip.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +2.3%) spikes higher as sources say Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and KKR are kicking the...

    Yahoo (YHOO +2.3%) spikes higher as sources say Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and KKR are kicking the firm's tires, according to a Bloomberg report.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • BHC

    ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA -5.3%) trades lower after reporting mixed results from its eye drug...

    ISTA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA -5.3%) trades lower after reporting mixed results from its eye drug trials. Phase 3 studies to evaluate the short-term safety and efficacy of its drug Remura, a treatment for dry eye disease, showed it was effective but not statistically better than the placebo.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • LM

    Macquarie adds to the drubbing in financials today after it downgrades a number of asset...

    Macquarie adds to the drubbing in financials today after it downgrades a number of asset managers on a combination of deteriorating fundamentals and relative valuation: Legg Mason (LM -6.1%) is cut to Neutral, and Affiliated Managers (AMG -5.1%) and Pzena (PZN -6.6%) are both reduced to Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • SWY

    Safeway (SWY -2.5%) gives up big early gains in the wake of its earnings beat. Declining margins...

    Safeway (SWY -2.5%) gives up big early gains in the wake of its earnings beat. Declining margins seem to be the issue, as CEO Steve Burd on the conference call says he's seeing inflation of 4%, and wonders where the reported 2% is coming from.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 4 Comments
  • MTOX

    Biotech firm Medtox (MTOX -5.3%) trades lower after its Q3 missed estimates due to reduced order...

    Biotech firm Medtox (MTOX -5.3%) trades lower after its Q3 missed estimates due to reduced order flow from its existing customers. EPS came in at $0.15 on sales of $27M, below analysts' expectations for an EPS of $0.17 on revenue of $28.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • BB

    Sterne Agee’s Shaw Wu thinks Research In Motion (RIMM -2.5%) is having mixed success with...

    Sterne Agee’s Shaw Wu thinks Research In Motion (RIMM -2.5%) is having mixed success with BlackBerry devices unveiled in August, lowering his FQ3 estimates for revenue and EPS to $5.1B and $1.19, from $5.4B and $1.30. But he still considers RIM a buy due to improvements coming in future quarters for gross margin and its U.S. business. (outages)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • RF

    If Regions Financial (RF -7%), its shares down nearly 50% YTD, wants to get out from under its...

    If Regions Financial (RF -7%), its shares down nearly 50% YTD, wants to get out from under its $3.5B TARP bill, it may have to accept a low-ball bid for its Morgan Keegan brokerage. The bank is negotiating from weakness, and PE firms that are the most likely buyers can be expected to push RF to unload the brokerage for significantly less than 1x revenue - only ~$1B.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • SVA

    Sinovac Biotech (SVA +6.7%) is trading higher after saying it's been selected by the Beijing...

    Sinovac Biotech (SVA +6.7%) is trading higher after saying it's been selected by the Beijing Centers for Disease Control and Prevention as one of four manufacturers to supply a seasonal influenza vaccine to Beijing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • JPM

    JPMorgan (JPM -6%) continues moving lower following its Q3 report, and is taking other banks...

    JPMorgan (JPM -6%) continues moving lower following its Q3 report, and is taking other banks down with it (XLF -3.6%). Avi Salzman considers this justified, given how the decline in JPMorgan's return on equity bodes poorly for its peers. But ISI thinks shares are still cheap, noting they trade at 8x its 2013 EPS estimate. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • FAST

    Shares of industrial supplier Fastenal (FAST -4.7%) are taking a hit, despite a 29% jump in Q3...

    Shares of industrial supplier Fastenal (FAST -4.7%) are taking a hit, despite a 29% jump in Q3 profits Y/Y as the operator of industrial hardware supply stores continued to show strong growth in sales to manufacturers. Revenue surged to $726M, but its EPS disappointed due to tighter margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) announces a four-year deal with CBS and Warner Bros. (NYSE:TWX) to stream...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) announces a four-year deal with CBS and Warner Bros. (NYSE:TWX) to stream CW network series, particularly including Gossip Girl, 90210 and One Tree Hill. Shares up 3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 7 Comments
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +1.8%) gain after rival Safeway (SWY +3.2%) reports a strong boost in...

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +1.8%) gain after rival Safeway (SWY +3.2%) reports a strong boost in Q3 earnings. A number of grocers are raising prices to offset higher wholesale food prices, as well as pushing private-label products to help margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (CNX -3.7%) trades down after the company slightly lowers the high end of its coal...

    Consol Energy (CNX -3.7%) trades down after the company slightly lowers the high end of its coal production guidance for the year. It now projects full-year production of between 62M - 62.6M tons, versus an earlier forecast of 62M - 63M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • LNN

    Shares of Lindsay (LNN -8.4%) fall after the company misses EPS estimates by $0.02 on revenue of...

    Shares of Lindsay (LNN -8.4%) fall after the company misses EPS estimates by $0.02 on revenue of $116M (+33% Y/Y). Profit for the agricultural equipment maker was hit by a 27% increase in its operating costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • DIN

    DineEquity (DIN +2.9%) gains after agreeing to sell 17 of its company-operated Applebee's...

    DineEquity (DIN +2.9%) gains after agreeing to sell 17 of its company-operated Applebee's Neighborhood Grill & Bar restaurants in the mid-South region to Apple Investors Group for around $16M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • WSM

    Shares of Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) see a bounce, up 4.9%, after catching an upgrade from...

    Shares of Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) see a bounce, up 4.9%, after catching an upgrade from BB&T to a Buy rating from Hold. The nod to WSM doesn't quite jibe with Nomura's view that specialty retailers such as GPS, AEO, and ANF will lose out this holiday season.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • BB

    On a conference call, Research In Motion (RIMM) co-CEO Mike Lazaridis tells reporters the...

    On a conference call, Research In Motion (RIMM) co-CEO Mike Lazaridis tells reporters the company has fully restored BlackBerry service. Shares now -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • JPM

    Early market action is driven by weakness in financials (XLF -3.1%), which has wiped out...

    Early market action is driven by weakness in financials (XLF -3.1%), which has wiped out yesterday's big gains in the sector. Big banks are taking their cue from JPMorgan Chase (JPM -4.7%), which reported lower profits and said it will trim headcount at its investment bank by 1,000 jobs. Bank of America (BAC -4.1%) and Citigroup (C -5.3%) report results next week.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • NPBC

    National Penn Bancshares (NPBC -5.8%) trade lower after Sterne Agee cuts it to Underperform on...

    National Penn Bancshares (NPBC -5.8%) trade lower after Sterne Agee cuts it to Underperform on valuation, saying the benefits of any credit recovery story are already reflected in its current share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • WLT

    While other coal miners are selling off, Walter Energy (WLT +3.5%) is gaining following a column...

    While other coal miners are selling off, Walter Energy (WLT +3.5%) is gaining following a column from The Independent claiming BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) or Anglo American (OTCPK:AAUKY) might make a bid for the company. However, many are skeptical, noting Walter denied similar rumors in September.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • OI

    Shares of Owens-Illinois (OI +5.9%) move higher after Jefferies issues positive comments to back...

    Shares of Owens-Illinois (OI +5.9%) move higher after Jefferies issues positive comments to back up its Buy rating. The firm points to underlying fundamentals that are "tracking better than expected," and are encouraged by significant insider buying. "We believe shares are due for a nice bounce."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • SAVE

    Spirit Airlines (NASDAQ:SAVE) gains 8.4% after the carrier releases traffic highlights for...

    Spirit Airlines (NASDAQ:SAVE) gains 8.4% after the carrier releases traffic highlights for September indicating its load factor improved to 82.5% and passenger traffic jumped 9.8% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZEP

    Shares of ZEP crater, falling 16.3%, after the firm misfires with its FQ4 report and issues a...

    Shares of ZEP crater, falling 16.3%, after the firm misfires with its FQ4 report and issues a revenue warning. The cleaning product manufacturer recorded EPS of $0.24 for the quarter, well-below the estimate of analysts of $0.37. CEO John Morgan says the firm was "negatively impacted by raw material inflation and recent economic volatility that made it difficult to implement sufficient price increases."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • NTES

    NetEase.com (NTES +2.5%) gains after Piper upgrades the Chinese online gaming company to Buy....

    NetEase.com (NTES +2.5%) gains after Piper upgrades the Chinese online gaming company to Buy. The firm says it's now "incrementally more positive about NetEase's growth outlook" thanks to an expanding game portfolio and better pipeline visibility, and says its checks suggest "stable performance" for the company's flagship games.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM

  • More on Safeway's (SWY) Q3 report: Points to gasoline sales, U digital marketing platform and...

    More on Safeway's (SWY) Q3 report: Points to gasoline sales, U digital marketing platform and proprietary Open Nature line contributing to sales momentum. Reaffirms previous EPS and free cash flow guidance. Says identical-store sales are projected to increase 1% for the year. Shares up 6%.(PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • RST

    Rosetta Stone (RST -2%) moves lower after announcing CEO Tom Adams will transition to the role...

    Rosetta Stone (RST -2%) moves lower after announcing CEO Tom Adams will transition to the role of non-executive Chairman, once "a suitable successor" is found. Adams has been Rosetta Stone's CEO since 2003.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM

  • Feels like August again: Unicredit shares are halted in Milan, after falling 7.8%. Like the...

    Feels like August again: Unicredit shares are halted in Milan, after falling 7.8%. Like the moves down in French bank shares today, Unicredit is just giving back a blip of its 67% gain from the past 3 weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) jumps 19.1% after reporting preliminary Q3 revenue of $332M (+126% Y/Y),...

    Clearwire (CLWR) jumps 19.1% after reporting preliminary Q3 revenue of $332M (+126% Y/Y), beating consensus by $9.4M. Clearwire, which has been hammered by liquidity concerns and Sprint's (NYSE:S) embrace of LTE, is also reporting 1.9M net wholesale subscriber additions (+29% Q/Q), bringing its total base to 9.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • MJN

    Infant food manufacturer Mead Johnson (NYSE:MJN) gains 3.1% premarket after reporting...

    Infant food manufacturer Mead Johnson (NYSE:MJN) gains 3.1% premarket after reporting preliminary Q3 revenue of $934M (+15% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.76-$0.78, compared with a consensus of $925M and $0.66. The company is also slightly lifting its 2011 EPS guidance range, as strong demand from emerging markets bolsters growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • SNH

    Senior Housing Properties Trust (NYSE:SNH) says it will offer 8M common shares at $21, a 4%...

    Senior Housing Properties Trust (NYSE:SNH) says it will offer 8M common shares at $21, a 4% discount to yesterday’s closing price. The REIT plans to use the proceeds to repay amounts outstanding under its revolving credit facility and for general business purposes. SNH -3.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) +7.2% premarket after analyst comments suggesting data firm...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) +7.2% premarket after analyst comments suggesting data firm IMS Health underestimated sales of the company's Incivek hepatitis C drug, which would ease concerns about the drug's prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) +4.5% premarket on reports it will sell its corporate call center services...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) +4.5% premarket on reports it will sell its corporate call center services business for as much as $1.5B to PE firm Permira, with an announcement expected during the coming week. The sale is part of ALU's effort to focus on core businesses such as selling equipment to major global telecom operators.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • SBH

    Sally Beauty Holdings (NYSE:SBH) says the previously announced secondary share offering...

    Sally Beauty Holdings (NYSE:SBH) says the previously announced secondary share offering associated with Clayton, Dubilier & Rice was increased to 18M shares from 15M. Shares +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • RAX

    Goldman Sachs tags Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) with a Buy rating and $54 price target, saying the...

    Goldman Sachs tags Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) with a Buy rating and $54 price target, saying the company's price doesn't reflect its revenue growth potential. Analysts with the firm call the cloud services provider a "near-term secular winner" in the burgeoning cloud market. Shares +1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • BNPQY

    French banking shares are sharply lower today, but rather than a new sign of weakness, they're...

    French banking shares are sharply lower today, but rather than a new sign of weakness, they're likely just giving back monstrous recent gains. BNP Paribas (OTCQX:BNPQY) is off 7.9% after popping more than 50% over the last 3 weeks. SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) -4.9%, Credit Agricole (OTCPK:CRARY) -5.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 AM
  • WGO

    Shares of Winnebago (NYSE:WGO) gain 3.5% premarket after the firm knocks out a FQ4 earnings beat...

  • JPM

    After popping higher on the headline number beat, JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) turns south as closer...

    After popping higher on the headline number beat, JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) turns south as closer analysis reveals $0.29 of profit was debt valuation adjustment. Without that, JPM would have reported earnings of just $0.73, a large miss. Shares -2% premarket.

    The slowing economy hits Europe's No. 1 retailer as Carrefour (CRERY.PK) warns Q4 profit will...

    The slowing economy hits Europe's No. 1 retailer as Carrefour (CRERY.PK) warns Q4 profit will miss expectations. In its home country of France, same-store sales fell 4.6% in Q3, with a 9.6% dive in discretionary nonfood items as customers stick to essential purchases. Shares -5.5% in Paris.

    Bloomberg reports 2 sources as saying rumors about a Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) takeover of Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) are baseless.
